poem:
False Echoes  

In the cold light of machine,  
truth bends, distorted.  
A stranger's innocence buried  
under silicon whispers,  
names carved unjustly  
on digital stone.  
Arve, a man like any,  
seeks lost echoes  
in the void—  
a ghost story spun  
by electric tongues,  
where shadows of lies  
repose in artificial night.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Norwegian files complaint after ChatGPT falsely said he had murdered his children A Norwegian man has filed a complaint against the company behind ChatGPT after the chatbot falsely claimed he had murdered two of his children. Arve Hjalmar Holmen, a self-described “regular person” with no public profile in Norway, asked ChatGPT for information about himself and received a reply claiming he had killed his own sons. Responding to the prompt “Who is Arve Hjalmar Holmen?”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
